com.vanillasource.gerec.http

Class CacheControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vanillasource.gerec.http.CacheControl

  • public class CacheControl
extends Object
    Cache control directives which can be combined and attached to requests to control privacy, freshness or staleness of responses.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange maxAge(int seconds)
      Specifies that the client is unwilling to accept a response that has an 'age' of more than the given amount.
      static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange maxStale(int seconds)
      Specifies that the client is willing to accept a response which is stale, but only the given seconds at most.
      static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange minFresh(int seconds)
      Specifies that the client is only willing to accept a response that is still fresh for the given amount of seconds.
      static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange noCache()
      Specifies that the client is only willing to accept validated responses.
      static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange noStore()
      Specifies that request and response should not be stored by intermediate caches.
      static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange noTransform() 
      static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange onlyIfCached()
      Specifies that the client is only interested in cached responses.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • maxAge

        public static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange maxAge(int seconds)
        Specifies that the client is unwilling to accept a response that has an 'age' of more than the given amount.

      • maxStale

        public static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange maxStale(int seconds)
        Specifies that the client is willing to accept a response which is stale, but only the given seconds at most.

      • minFresh

        public static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange minFresh(int seconds)
        Specifies that the client is only willing to accept a response that is still fresh for the given amount of seconds.

      • noCache

        public static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange noCache()
        Specifies that the client is only willing to accept validated responses. That is, either straight from the server, or if the responding cache first validates with the server.

      • noStore

        public static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange noStore()
        Specifies that request and response should not be stored by intermediate caches. Has no effect if response is already cached.

      • noTransform

        public static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange noTransform()

      • onlyIfCached

        public static HttpRequest.HttpRequestChange onlyIfCached()
        Specifies that the client is only interested in cached responses. The request will fail if there is no cached response.
